Indian equity benchmarks closed positively, with key indices showing gains in three out of four trading sessions during the week.

The S&P BSE Sensex rose by 1.63% to settle at 80,501.99, and the CNX Nifty was up by 1.28%, closing at 24,346.70.

Mid-cap stocks also saw positive movement, while small-cap stocks experienced a slight decline.

A consolidated circular regarding equity derivatives was issued by the Metropolitan Stock Exchange of India Limited (MSE) on April 30, 2025.

This circular references a SEBI circular from April 20, 2023, and provides a single document outlining regulations, policies, and operational functionalities for trading in the Equity Derivatives Segment.

The circular covers various aspects, including product descriptions for stock futures, contract trading cycles, trading hours, expiry details, and other important aspects related to trading and surveillance in the Futures and Options (F&O) segment.
